intro: Rostellularia orbiculata, commonly known as the orbiculate rostellularia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical and subtropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its orbicular (round) leaves and showy, yellow flowers that bloom in clusters. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it suitable for cultivation in warm climates. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes grown in botanical gardens and as a houseplant.
